fu.util

Class LargeArrayVLWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • fu.util.LargeArrayVLWriter

  • public class LargeArrayVLWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    A LargeArray is a nearly infinite large persistent array that, once written, can only be read. This object models "writing", the corresponding reading provides LargeArray. From the array, only a certain number of files is read into the memory, thus even large arrays can be manage at runtime. This class allows to create a LargeArray. It can only sequentially be written to the files.

      Creates a LargeArray with variable record length ("VL").

    • Constructor Detail

      • LargeArrayVLWriter

        public LargeArrayVLWriter(java.lang.String rootDir,
                          java.lang.String filePrefix,
                          int recsPerFile)
        Creates a LargeArray with variable record length ("VL").
        Parameters:
        rootDir - directory that is used to store the LargeArray
        filePrefix - the file names prefix used to store the data
        recsPerFile - number of records per file

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public int write(byte[] rec)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Write a record. It returns the index number that can be used to read the record later.
        Parameters:
        rec - content
        Returns:
        index number of the new records
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if underlying files cannot be read

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Writes all to disk, especially write the config file. Don't forget to perform close after all writes, as otherwise the large array is not usable later.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if underlying files cannot be read
